intro: Wahlenbergia gracilis f. littoralis, commonly known as the coastal bluebell, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, blue to violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, thriving in coastal environments with salt spray. It is a perennial herb that produces delicate foliage and is often found in dune ecosystems. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and restoration projects.
